This is all normal opening theory, however normally you tell your kids to develop the bishop and nights fast, in this case black want to open the center, less good (from my point) would be d6 followed by Bg4, as the only thing the bishop can do is to exchange with the night (after h3), I could also consider d6, Be6, Qd7 and put the Bishop on h3, but normally white have too many good moves in the meantime and I need the other pices to help me.

First mistake - he should have exchanged on d4 with 22.cxd4, exd4 23.Na3, Ne5 24.Rad1,Qc5 (allow to switch to the king-flank) 25.Nc2,Bg4 26.f3,Bxf3 27.Bxf3,Rxg3+ 28.Bg2,d3+ Kh1 and I  have been analyzing this a lot, I believe that black has the best chance, but it is not without chances for white.
Big mistake - He had to play 23.Qc1 and I would continue with Nd4 and I believe that black has a nice game, but still a long way to the win.
